description: Observability dashboard for Vector Database operations including Chroma, Qdrant, and other vector stores

panels.description: Current Vector DB request rate showing the number of database operations per second across all services. This metric helps monitor system load and demand patterns for capacity planning.
Total number of Vector DB operations completed, providing a direct measure of usage volume. Monitoring this helps in assessing demand on Vector DB services.
95th percentile response time for Vector DB operations. This shows how long the slowest 5% of requests take to complete, indicating system performance under load.
Median response time for Vector DB operations, showing typical system performance. This represents the middle value where 50% of requests complete faster and 50% take longer.
Request volume distribution across different Vector DB systems over time
panels.title: Request Volume by DB

panels.description: 95th percentile response time performance showing latency trends across different Vector DB systems over time
panels.title: Response Time Trends

panels.description: Success rate trends showing the percentage of successful Vector DB operations over time
panels.title: Request Success Rate

panels.description: Top 10 database operations ranked by total request count
panels.title: Top Database Operations by Count

panels.description: Request rate per second grouped by database operation and system
panels.title: Request rate by operation

panels.description: Request distribution by environment showing production vs development vs testing usage patterns over time.
panels.title: Request Rate by Environment

panels.description: Total requests per second grouped by database system
panels.title: Request Rate by Database

panels.description: Request rate trends broken down by service, showing which applications are driving Vector DB usage patterns over time.
panels.title: Request Rate by Service

panels.description: Average response time trends across all Vector DB systems, providing overall system health monitoring.
panels.title: Overall System Performance Health

panels.description: Distribution of Vector DB requests across different Vector database systems like Chroma, Qdrant, Pinecone, etc. It shows platform usage patterns and helps guide strategic decisions for integration or optimization.
panels.title: Requests by System

panels.description: Distribution of Vector DB requests by environment, such as production, development, testing. It shows where the requests are being utilized, providing insights into operational focus and deployment strategies.
panels.title: Requests by Environment

panels.description: Distribution of Vector DB requests by service, showing which applications or services are using vector databases most frequently.
panels.title: Requests by Service

panels.description: 95th percentile latency distribution heatmap by Vector DB system. The intensity of colors represents the concentration of requests at different latency levels, helping identify performance patterns.
panels.title: Latency Distribution

panels.description: Average response time for database operations

targets.expr: sum by(db_operation_name) (rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_sum{telemetry_sdk_name="openlit", service_name=~"$service_name", deployment_environment=~"$deployment_environment"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(db_operation_name) (rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_count{telemetry_sdk_name="openlit", service_name=~"$service_name", deployment_environment=~"$deployment_environment"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Average Operation Latency

panels.description: 95th percentile response time for database operations
panels.title: 95th Percentile Operation Latency

panels.description: This panel shows detailed trace information for GenAI requests, including trace IDs, service names, operation names, and durations. Click on trace IDs to view detailed trace analysis and understand request flow through your system.

Instructions for viewing detailed trace information. Click on trace IDs in the traces table, then click the traces link, and refresh the dashboard to see the complete trace visualization with span details.

options.content:
> To View Traces:
>  1. Click the **Trace ID** on the left table .
>  2. Click **Traces link**.
>  1. Refresh the dashboard.

panels.description: This panel displays the selected trace visualization. Use the trace ID variable or click on traces in the table above to view detailed span information, timing, and request flow through your GenAI services.

title: VectorDB Observability
